channel.title: TRAIN Conference
channel.description: TRAIN Conference (Calgary, Alberta, Canada) offers seminars and resources to equip and encourage Christian leaders, workers and volunteers in their ministry areas.

item.title: TRAIN 2007 Conference (November 3) -- "Under Construction"
item.description: 2007 is a transitional year for the TRAIN Conference. We have begun new relationships with a number of local Bible colleges. We don't know for sure what future conferences will look like yet, but we're very excited about the possibilities -- TRAIN is under construction! But What does this mean for 2007? We're going to offer a somewhat more condensed conference this year. The focus will be on children's and youth ministries, and we're also striving to bring back the Resource Centre.

item.title: Conference Information
item.description: The TRAIN 2007 Conference will be held at Bethany Chapel -- 3333 Richardson Way SW, Calgary, AB, CANADA. This year, choose one of five tracks -- Preschool Ministry, Children's Ministry, Youth Ministry, Leadership or Multi-Generational Ministry -- to attend for all three sessions (see schedule). A hot lunch will be served.

item.title: How to Register
item.description: There are three ways to register for the TRAIN 2007 Conference: online (recommended), mail-in and walk-in. The registration fees are described in detail, and all include a hot lunch. A list of hotels with the easiest access to the conference location is provided for convenience.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: Our privacy policy states what information we collect and what we do with it. We DON'T share any personal information with any third parties. Also, individuals, churches and organizations are reminded that they may opt-in or opt-out of our mailing list at any time.

item.title: Who We Are
item.description: The first TRAIN Conference was held in 1983. Every year since, as the baton is passed on to new committe members, we hope that we will be able to encourage, train, provide purpose-filled resources and develop Christian workers and leaders. Contact us if you have any questions or comments, or if you are interested in volunteering with us in the future. We are pleased to be partnering with a number of Bible colleges.
